100 brutal queue experiments for distributed sanity

docs.title: 🧠 CuttingQueues
docs.text:
A brutalist’s field manual to mastering Celery, Redis, and distributed queues — one failure at a time.

Welcome to CuttingQueues, an open engineering journey by Venugopalan Iyengar.

This project contains 100 experiments in Celery and Redis that systematically build your understanding of: - Queue fairness - Fault tolerance - Worker orchestration - Tail latency control - Metrics, telemetry, and reliability

Each task is a self-contained experiment — with source code, failure reports, metrics, and a distilled insight.

docs.title: 🧩 How to Use
docs.text:
• Start from Task #1 — Prefork vs Solo.
  • Run each experiment locally using docker-compose up.
  • Observe metrics on Prometheus & Grafana.
  • Read each task’s analysis under /docs/100_tasks/.

docs.title: 💬 Philosophy
docs.text: "Every queue hides a truth about your system’s pain." CuttingQueues is not just a guide — it’s a debugging philosophy.
